Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Monocle \Mon"o*cle\, n. [F. See {Monocular}.] An eyeglass for one eye. --Simmonds. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Eyeglass \Eye"glass`\, n. 1. A lens of glass worn in front of the eye to assist vision; -- usually used in the plural, referring to a pair of lenses fixed together in a frame, and worn resting on the bridge of the nose, to improve the vision. A single eyeglass in a frame is called a {monocle}. [1913 Webster +PJC]
2. Eyepiece of a telescope, microscope, etc. [1913 Webster]
3. The retina. [Poetic] [1913 Webster]
4. A glass eyecup. See {Eyecup}. [1913 Webster]
monocle n : lens for correcting defective vision in one eye; held in place by facial muscles [syn: {eyeglass}]
